Sentencas: Interface engineering can be used to tune the properties of heterostructure materials at an atomic level, yielding exceptional final physical properties.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, we synthesized a heterostructure of a p-type semiconductor (NiO) and an n-type semiconductor (CeO2) for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The CeO2-NiO heterostructure exhibited high ionic conductivity of 0.2 S cm(-1) at 530 degrees C, which was further improved to 0.29 S cm(-1) by the introduction of Na+ ions.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: When it was applied in the fuel cell, an excellent power density of 571 mW cm(-1) was obtained, indicating that the CeO2-NiO heterostructure can provide favorable electrolyte functionality.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The prepared CeO2-NiO heterostructures possessed both proton and oxygen ionic conductivities, with oxygen ionic conductivity dominating the fuel cell reaction.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Further investigations in terms of electrical conductivity and electrode polarization, a proton and oxygen ionic co-conducting mechanism, and a mechanism for blocking electron transport showed that the reconstruction of the energy band at the interfaces was responsible for the enhanced ionic conductivity and cell power output.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This work presents a new methodology and scientific understanding of semiconductor-based heterostructures for advanced ceramic fuel cells.
Titulo: An Interface Heterostructure of NiO and CeO2 for Using Electrolytes of Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
